plentry.pd: The App ID issued by Agora to the App developer. Apps using the same App ID can join the same channel for communication or live streaming. An App ID can only be used to create one . To change the App ID, you must call to destroy the current before creating a new one.
Channel profile. See .
Audio scenario. Different scenarios correspond to different volume types on the device. See .
Region for accessing the server. This is an advanced setting suitable for scenarios with restricted access. Supported regions are listed in . Bitwise operations are supported for region codes.
Sets the log files output by the SDK. See . By default, the SDK generates 5 SDK log files and 5 API call log files, with the following rules:

Whether to enable domain restriction:
: Enable domain restriction. This setting is suitable for IoT devices accessing the network via IoT SIM cards. The SDK only connects to servers in the domain or IP whitelist registered with the carrier.
: (Default) Disable domain restriction. This setting is suitable for most general scenarios.

Whether to automatically register Agora extensions when initializing :
: (Default) Automatically register Agora extensions when initializing .
: Do not register Agora extensions when initializing . You need to call to register them.

The App ID issued by Agora to the App developer. Only apps using the same App ID can join the same channel for communication or live streaming. An App ID can only be used to create one . To change the App ID, you must first call to destroy the current and then recreate it.
The channel profile. See .
The audio scenario. Different audio scenarios use different volume types. See .

The region for connecting to the server. This is an advanced setting for scenarios with access security requirements. Supported regions are listed in . Bitwise operations are supported for region codes.
Sets the log files output by the SDK. See . By default, the SDK generates 5 SDK log files and 5 API call log files, with the following rules:

Whether to enable domain restriction:
: Enables domain restriction. This setting is applicable when IoT devices access the network using IoT SIM cards. The SDK connects only to servers on the domain or IP whitelist reported to the carrier.
: (Default) Disables domain restriction. This setting is suitable for most common scenarios.

Whether to automatically register Agora extensions when initializing :
: (Default) Automatically registers Agora extensions when initializing .
: Does not register Agora extensions when initializing . You need to call to register the Agora extensions.

The App ID issued by Agora to the app developer. Only apps using the same App ID can join the same channel for communication or live streaming. One App ID can only be used to create one . To change the App ID, you must first call to destroy the current and then create a new one.
Channel usage scenario. See .
Audio scenario. Different audio scenarios correspond to different volume types on the device. See .

The region for accessing the server. This is an advanced setting suitable for scenarios with access security restrictions. Supported regions are listed in . The region code supports bitwise operations.
Sets the log files output by the SDK. See . By default, the SDK generates 5 SDK log files and 5 API call log files, following these rules:

Whether to enable domain name restriction:
: Enable domain name restriction. This setting is suitable for IoT devices accessing the network using IoT SIM cards. The SDK will only connect to servers whose domain names or IPs are whitelisted and reported to the carrier.
: (default) Disable domain name restriction. This setting is suitable for most general scenarios.

Whether to automatically register Agora extensions when initializing :
: (default) Automatically register Agora extensions when initializing .
: Do not register Agora extensions when initializing . You need to call to register the Agora extensions.
Event handler of . See .

The App ID issued by Agora to the developer. Only apps using the same App ID can join the same channel for a call or live broadcast. An App ID can only be used to create one . To change the App ID, you must call to destroy the current and then create a new one.

ul.li: On Windows, context is the window handle. If set, it indicates support for hot-plugging devices.
On Android, context is the Android activity context.

plentry.pd: Channel profile. See .
Audio scenario. Different audio scenarios have different volume types. See .
Region for accessing the server. This is an advanced setting suitable for scenarios with access security restrictions. Supported regions are listed in . Area codes support bitwise operations.
Sets the log files output by the SDK. See . By default, the SDK generates 5 SDK log files and 5 API call log files, following these rules:

Whether to enable domain name restriction:
: Enable domain name restriction. This setting is suitable for IoT devices accessing the network using IoT SIM cards. The SDK will only connect to servers in the domain or IP whitelist reported to the carrier.
: (Default) Disable domain name restriction. This setting is suitable for most common scenarios.

Whether to automatically register Agora extensions when initializing :
: (Default) Automatically register Agora extensions when initializing .
: Do not register Agora extensions when initializing . You need to call to register the Agora extensions.
